intro: Klasea litwinowii, commonly known as the Litwinowii's klasea, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Klasea litwinowii is considered a species of conservation concern.
